Considerable cloudiness PERIOD Low 41F PERIOD Winds light and variable PERIOD

Updated November     pm















Five Americans freed by Iran in a highstakes prisoner swap landed back in the United States on Tuesday to a joyous reunion with family members PERIOD

The five arrived aboard an executive jet at a military airfield in Fort Belvoir southwest of Washington PERIOD

Relatives waved US flags and hugged the freed prisoners as they disembarked from the aircraft then posed for a group photograph grinning widely PERIOD

 National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan posted on X formerly Twitter PERIOD

The former prisoners including one held for eight years were part of a rare prisoner exchange between Washington and Tehran a deal that included the unfreezing of  billion in funds frozen by US ally South Korea PERIOD

The swap marked a slight thaw in relations between the two countries over a host of issues including Irans advances in its nuclear program although some observers urged caution in viewing the release as a sign of change PERIOD

The prisoners arrived on a flight from the Gulf state of Qatar which helped facilitate the exchange negotiated over several months PERIOD They will receive a medical checkup in the Washington area PERIOD

Iran which does not recognize dual nationalities is still holding a number of European nationals including Jamshid Sharmahd a German citizen sentenced to death PERIOD

At the United Nations EU foreign policy chief Josep Borrell on Tuesday met Iranian Foreign Minister Hossein AmirAbdollahian and voiced the blocs  over continued detentions an EU statement said PERIOD

President Joe Bidens administration says that no further US citizens are known to be in Iranian prisons PERIOD

It has rejected criticism at home that it was paying  insisting the money will be used only for humanitarian purposes with a threat to refreeze the funds if not PERIOD

It insists that it is not relieving sanctions PERIOD

Iran has insisted it has full access to the funds PERIOD

Addressing the United Nations General Assembly Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi said that sanctions reimposed by the United States were a  that had failed PERIOD

 Raisi said PERIOD

But in his own speech at the United Nations Biden vowed to work with allies to 

The United States remains  Biden said PERIOD

Unlike European powers the United States maintains no diplomatic relations with Irans clerical state established after the overthrow of the proWestern shah in  PERIOD

Secretary of State Antony Blinken said the prisoner issue was a separate track from moribund talks on reviving a  nuclear deal trashed by former president Donald Trump PERIOD

One of the freed prisoners praised Biden for ignoring the domestic political backlash and taking the  that released them PERIOD

 Siamak Namazi a businessman held by Iran since  said in a statement PERIOD

Other freed prisoners include wildlife conservationist Morad Tahbaz and venture capitalist Emad Sharqi both of whom were held at the notorious Evin Prison but placed under house arrest last month PERIOD

Two other US prisoners involved in the swap have not been publicly identified PERIOD

The five Iranian prisoners released by the United States were convicted or charged with nonviolent crimes with one already set to be released soon officials said PERIOD

France which backs the nuclear agreement and considers four of its nationals to be arbitrarily detained by Iran warned against drawing a link PERIOD

 French Foreign Minister Catherine Colonna told reporters PERIOD
